comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: Google Books has a publication titled: Impeachment a monograph on the Impeachment of the Federal Judiciary, by Wrisley Brown who is identified as "special assistant to the Attorney General, involved in the impeachment of Judge Robert W. Archibald of the U.S. Commerce Court. The publication is published in Washtington in 1914 at the direction of Mr. Root. From Biographical Directory of the U.S. Congress: ROWLAND, Charles Hedding, (1860-1921) a Representative from Pennsylvania; born in Hancock, Washington County, Md., December 20, 1860; moved to Huntingdon County, Pa., in 1866 and to Houtzdale, Pa., in 1874; attended the public schools; president of the Moshannon Coal Mining Co. and of the Pittsburgh & Susquehanna Railroad Co.; elected as a Republican to the Sixty-fourth and Sixty-fifth Congresses (March 4, 1915-March 3, 1919); declined to be a candidate for renomination in 1918; died in Philipsburg, Centre County, Pa., on November 24, 1921; interment in the Philipsburg Cemetery.
